sn35.95:1.1: Then Venerable Māluṅkyaputta went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn35.95:1.2: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
sn35.95:2.1: “Well now, Māluṅkyaputta, what are we to say to the young monks,
sn35.95:2.2: when even an old man like you, elderly and senior, advanced in years, having reached the final stage of life, asks for brief advice?”
sn35.95:3.1: “Sir, even though I’m an old man, elderly and senior,
sn35.95:3.2: may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief! May the Holy one please teach me in brief! Hopefully I can understand the meaning of what the Buddha says. Hopefully I can be an heir of the Buddha’s teaching!”
sn35.95:4.2: Do you have any desire or greed or fondness for sights known by the eye that you haven’t seen, you’ve never seen before, you don’t see, and you don’t think would be seen?”
sn35.95:5.1: “Do you have any desire or greed or affection for sounds known by the ear …
sn35.95:9.1: thoughts known by the mind that you haven’t known, you’ve never known before, you don’t know, and you don’t think would be known?”
sn35.95:10.1: “In that case, when it comes to things that are to be seen, heard, thought, and known: in the seen will be merely the seen; in the heard will be merely the heard; in the thought will be merely the thought; in the known will be merely the known.
sn35.95:10.7: you won’t be in this world or the world beyond or in between the two.
sn35.95:10.8: Just this is the end of suffering.”
sn35.95:11.1: “This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:
sn35.95:12.1: ‘When you see a sight, mindfulness is lost
sn35.95:12.2: as attention latches on a pleasant feature.
sn35.95:12.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:13.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.

sn35.95:36.3: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this. And he repeated the verses in full.
sn35.95:41.1: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”
sn35.95:42.1: And then Venerable Māluṅkyaputta approved and agreed with what the Buddha said. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
sn35.95:42.2: Then Māluṅkyaputta, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
sn35.95:42.3: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
sn35.95:42.4: And Venerable Māluṅkyaputta became one of the perfected.
